description: The Perth Lynx have announced Ryan Petrik as there new head coach for the upcoming WNBL season.
text:
The Perth Lynx have announced Ryan Petrik as there new head coach for the
upcoming WNBL season.Petrik signed the two-year deal after four seasons at the
club as an assistant coach under former boss Andy Stewart.EXCLUSIVE | Bringing
superstar Sami Whitcomb back to the Lynx: PetrikHe has claimed two Women's
State Basketball League titles as coach of the Rockingham Flames over seven
years with the southern powerhouse and was also named WSBL coach of the year
in 2012.The WNBL recently announced a November 20 start date for the 2020/21
season."The WNBL has some of the best coaches and players in the world, to be
able to compete against them is really exciting," said Petrik via a club
statement."There's a wealth of talent in the WA system we want to tap in to;
both in juniors coming through the BWA State Program and in the College
Pathway, in addition to the players competing in our State League."The Lynx in
March announced that the club's licence would be transferred from Perth
Wildcats' owner Jack Bendat back to Basketball Western Australian.Over a five-
year stint under Wildcats management, the club exceeded expectation and
returned to being a competitive member of the WNBL, even reaching a grand
final series in 2016.The league recently announced that restricted players,
imports, would not be allowed for the upcoming season which likely helps
Petrik when building his roster for before round one.

relations.sentence: The Perth Lynx have announced Ryan Petrik as there new head coach for the upcoming WNBL season.

"The Lynx in March announced that the club's licence would be transferred from Perth Wildcats' owner Jack Bendat back to Basketball Western Australian.Over a five- year stint under Wildcats management, the club exceeded expectation and returned to being a competitive member of the WNBL, even reaching a grand final series in 2016.The league recently announced that restricted players, imports, would not be allowed for the upcoming season which likely helps Petrik when building his roster for before round one.

The Perth Lynx have announced Ryan Petrik as there new head coach for the upcoming WNBL season.

Petrik signed the two-year deal after four seasons at the club as an assistant coach under former boss Andy Stewart.EXCLUSIVE | Bringing superstar Sami Whitcomb back to the Lynx: PetrikHe has claimed two Women's State Basketball League titles as coach of the Rockingham Flames over seven years with the southern powerhouse and was also named WSBL coach of the year in 2012.The WNBL recently announced a November 20 start date for the 2020/21 season.

title: Perth Lynx announce Ryan Petrik as new head coach for upcoming WNBL season [The West Australian]
html: The Perth Lynx have announced Ryan Petrik as there new head coach for the upcoming WNBL season.Petrik signed the two-year deal after four seasons at the club as an assistant coach under former boss Andy Stewart.EXCLUSIVE | Bringing superstar Sami Whitcomb back to the Lynx: PetrikHe has claimed two Women’s State Basketball League titles as coach of the Rockingham Flames over seven years with the southern powerhouse and was also named WSBL coach of the year in 2012.The WNBL recently announced a November 20 start date for the 2020/21 season.“The WNBL has some of the best coaches and players in the world, to be able to compete against them is really exciting,” said Petrik via a club statement.“There’s a wealth of talent in the WA system we want to tap in to; both in juniors coming through the BWA State Program and in the College Pathway, in addition to the players competing in our State League.”The Lynx in March announced that the club’s licence would be transferred from Perth Wildcats’ owner Jack Bendat back to Basketball Western Australian.Over a five-year stint under Wildcats management, the club exceeded expectation and returned to being a competitive member of the WNBL, even reaching a grand final series in 2016.The league recently announced that restricted players, imports, would not be allowed for the upcoming season which likely helps Petrik when building his roster for before round one.
